alert.note: Alert for Erie; Lorain; Ottawa; Sandusky (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 9:19PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ottawa, Erie, eastern Sandusky and northern Lorain Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 919 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles northwest of Kelleys Island to near Put-In-Bay to near Port Clinton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lorain, Elyria, Sandusky, Fremont, Vermilion, Western Vermilion, Port Clinton, Westlake, North Ridgeville, Avon Lake, Amherst, Grafton, Clyde, Northern Milan, Castalia, North Olmsted, Avon, Bay Village, Sheffield Lake and Olmsted Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northwestern Ohio.
